title: Roman
content:
1. Having to do with the city of Rome, Italy.

2. Having to do with the Holy Roman Empire, Byzantine Empire, Roman Empire, Roman Republic, the ancient city of Rome, or its culture, history, and traditions.

3. Upright—as opposed to [oblique](http://web.archive.org/web/20120826034915/http:/typophile.com/wiki/oblique) or [italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20120826034915/http:/typophile.com/wiki/italic)—styles.

4. Serif type.

5. A reference to the [Roman Alphabet](http://web.archive.org/web/20120826034915/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Roman%20Alphabet) or [Latin](http://web.archive.org/web/20120826034915/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Latin).
author: dan_reynolds
